title: What Does the 🖤 Black Heart Emoji Mean?

steps.title: It symbolizes love or affection.
steps.content: It symbolizes love or affection. No matter the color, a heart is a heart nonetheless. Despite its dark shade, a 🖤 represents love and affection. Someone may send this emoji alone or at the end of a sentence to show that they care for you. “Thanks for helping me today🖤” “I don’t know where I’d be without you🖤” A black heart emoji can have a different meaning depending on who texts it. Find out what it means if a guy you're talking to sends it in our "What does a black heart mean from a guy?" forum .

steps.title: It represents dark humor.
steps.content: It represents dark humor. When making a morbid or twisted joke, a 🖤 can be paired with other emojis. Someone may use a black heart to lighten the joke and show you that they’re only kidding. [1] X Research source “Relationships are ropes🖤😵” “Should I get the bleach? Jk😂😂🖤”

steps.title: It shows mourning or loss.
steps.content: It shows mourning or loss. If someone’s lost a loved one, they may use a 🖤 to say they’re in mourning. Followers and friends may also comment with a series of black hearts to show support and say “RIP.” “May you rest in peace grandma🖤🪦🥀” “I’m so sorry for your loss🖤”

steps.title: Someone’s feeling misunderstood or emo.
steps.content: Someone’s feeling misunderstood or emo. A 🖤 can represent dark emotions too difficult to explain. If someone believes they have a dark heart, they may use a black heart when texting to symbolize their dark attitude. “I feel like no one’s listening to me🖤” “I like the way I am😈🖤”

steps.title: Support for the Black Lives Matter movement.
steps.content: Support for the Black Lives Matter movement. In recent years, a 🖤 has become a symbol for BLM, along with the 🤎 ( brown heart emoji ). If you see this emoji online along with #BLM or ✊🏿✊🏾✊🏽✊🏼✊🏻, it represents solidarity for the movement. [2] X Research source “BLM🖤🙏🏾” “Standing up for what’s right🖤”

steps.title: Show some love.
steps.content: Show some love. Whether it’s for your partner, best friend, or a relative, send a 🖤 to say “I love you.” You can send it by itself or at the end of a sweet message . “You’re too nice to me🖤” “Missing you today🖤”

steps.title: Tell a dark joke.
steps.content: Tell a dark joke. Use a 🖤 to give your dark humor some flare. This emoji will let your friends know you’re simply making a joke . “I 🖤 how he smiled in the death scene.” “Why did the man miss the funeral? He wasn’t a mourning person🖤🤣”

steps.title: Say you’re sad.
steps.content: Say you’re sad. Maybe you're mourning or had a terrible day. You can use the 🖤 to tell friends you’re feeling down. “Thanks for your support. Today wasn’t a good day🖤” “🖤😔”

steps.title: Join the Black Lives Matter movement.
steps.content: Join the Black Lives Matter movement. Show that you support BLM by adding a 🖤 to your social media bios. You can also add this supportive emoji to a post about the movement. “🖤✊🏿✊🏾✊🏽✊🏼✊🏻🖤” “#BLM🖤”

steps.title: Show support for all love.
steps.content: Show support for all love. Add a 🖤 in a stream of rainbow hearts to your social media bios as support for LGBTQ+ movements. Captioning a post with this will also tell your followers you support the cause. “​❤️​🧡​💛​💚​💙​💜​🖤​”​

steps.title: The 🖤 isn’t the only colored heart emoji.
steps.content: The 🖤 isn’t the only colored heart emoji. Pairing the black heart emoji with other hearts can make a unique meaning. Here are some other common heart emojis and definitions you can combine with a black heart emoji: [3] X Research source 🤍 ( white heart ): Pure love ❤️ (red heart): True love 💛 ( yellow heart ): Happiness 💚 ( green heart ): Jealousy 💜 ( purple heart ): Compassion 💙 ( blue heart ): Trust 🧡 ( orange heart ): Friendship 🤎 ( brown heart ): Racial equality
